note: Confrontation was only a limited success, but trade overcame communism and opened the door to China at last.
title: The U.S.A. had long believed that China was the key to the markets of the world. Defeat of Japan in the Second World War made the U.S. the dominant power in the Pacific, but not China as it expected. Instead the U.S. found itself confronting Chinese communism, and trading around the Pacific with coastal states outside communist control
